newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan plastics shares jump, eye China demand.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan plastics shares jump, eye China demand.

text.p: Taiwan's plastic shares climbed at mid-morning on Monday on hopes for rising plastic raw material demand from China, brokers said.
After 70 minutes, the plastics sector was up 1.02 percent against a 0.09 percent rise in the overall market.
Union Petrochemical rose 70 cents or 2.37 percent to T$30.3 and Grand Petrochemical gained 60 cents or 2.26 percent to T$27.2. Both topped the market's actives list.

"Communist China's recent rate cuts are expected to trigger rising demand for plastic raw materials from its state-run firms, and Taiwan's plastic makers are expected to benefit from that," said Tank Hung of Yuanta Securities.
